allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: prevent verbatim user notes from being injected into QA retry prompts

Problem: User rejection notes were being copied verbatim into retry
generation prompts, causing prompt pollution and inconsistent behavior.

Solution: Convert all user feedback to structured patterns/categories.

Changes:
- analyze-rejection: Extract rejection patterns, not verbatim text
- optimize-pipeline-prompt: Use sentiment analysis instead of raw comments
- human-feedback-memory: Show pattern tags [extra_furniture, camera_mismatch]
  instead of verbatim quotes

Files modified:
- supabase/functions/analyze-rejection/index.ts
- supabase/functions/optimize-pipeline-prompt/index.ts
- supabase/functions/_shared/human-feedback-memory.ts
- docs/QA_FEEDBACK_FIX_SUMMARY.md \(new\)
- docs/QA_FEEDBACK_FIX_DELIVERABLES.md \(new\)

Testing: User note ""Too much clutter"" now becomes pattern [extra_furniture,
minimalism_preference] in retry prompts, not verbatim text.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: add comprehensive Langfuse tracing diagnostics

Added diagnostic logging to identify why Langfuse traces aren''t appearing.
All changes are temporary and non-blocking - pipeline continues if Langfuse fails.

Changes:
- langfuse-client.ts: Added diagnostic logs for config, trace, generation, and flush
- run-space-analysis.ts: Added connectivity test and trace creation diagnostics
- verify-langfuse-config \(new\): Dedicated endpoint to check Langfuse configuration
- LANGFUSE_DIAGNOSTIC_GUIDE.md \(new\): Complete diagnostic and troubleshooting guide
- LANGFUSE_RESTORE_SUMMARY.md \(new\): Implementation summary and action items

Diagnostic logs show:
- Environment variable status \(safe - no secrets logged\)
- Connectivity test results
- Trace/generation creation status
- Event queue and flush operations
- HTTP response codes from Langfuse API

Next steps:
1. Run: npx supabase functions invoke verify-langfuse-config
2. Check run-space-analysis logs for [LANGFUSE_DIAGNOSTIC] entries
3. Fix any identified issues \(env vars, connectivity, etc.\)
4. Remove diagnostic logs once working

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
